_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

1) Facility
Elcon Inc. and Elcon/macroMetalics are a small, privately owned, sister companies manufacturing metal and ceramic components for the Electronic Industry.
Elcon makes components by photo engraving, etching and plating metals sheets and machined metals.
MacroMetalics metalizes ceramics with Tungsten/Molybdenum and or Manganese inks, fires the metalization and plates the components.

2) Regulated substances handled. Elcon and macroMetalics use:

Potassium Ferricyanide etchers and Ferric Chloride etchers(up to 80 gallon tanks).
Caustic surfactant cleaners(up to 40 gallon tanks)
Hydrochloric Acid, Hydrofluoric Acid, Sulfuric Acid, Nitric Acid and mixed acid cleaners (up to 20 gallon tanks)
Cyanide cleaners and strippers (up to 20 gallon tanks)
a Chromate cleaner (20 gallons)
Nickel, Copper and Indium Plating, and Gold and Silver Cyanide Plating tanks (up to 45 gallons per bath).
Acetone and Isopropyl Alcohol are used as cleaning and drying agents.

There are also 5 furnaces which use Hydrogen and Nitrogen for heating materials up to about 900 Celsius.

3) Elcon and macroMetalics have the following Safety and Environmental Specifications:

AP0900   Environmental Policy
EP0901-2002        Hazardous Materials Business Plan  (HMBP)
EP0902  Chemical Requirements, Handling, Storage, Disposal
EP0903  Hazardous Waste/Spent Chemical Handling and Disposal
AP0904  Safety Handbook
AP0905  Safety Inspections
AP0906  Production Floor Housekeeping
EP0910   Wastewater Monitoring
AP0912  Storm Water Pollution Problem Prevention Plan  (SWPPP)
AP0922  Fire Prevention Plan
AP0927  Hazard Communication, Chemicals and Waste Training
EP0929  Emergency Response Plan
AP0931 Respiratory Protection Program
AP0933Lockout/TagOut Procedure
Training is done on a yearly cycle and as new employees join the company.

4) Worse Case scenarios:

Elcon and macroMetalics transfer all new chemicals manually (in containers from vendors). 
Used (diluted or mixed) chemicals that are to

be waste treated are pumped into 55 gallon drums in discrete overpack containers and moved to the Waste Water Treatment area.
Used (diluted or mixed) chemicals that are to be treated off-site are pumped into 55 gallon drums and stored in metal storage sheds outside.

Worst case scenarios for a toxic substances are spillage of new 15 gallon container of Hydrochloric Acid or a used (diluted) 55 gallon container of Hydrochloric acid.  The facility has absorbent material specific for cleanup of small spills and a dike for containment of larger spills outside.

Worst case scenarios for a flammable substances is the loss of containment of a bottle of Hydrogen gas (220 SCF) used in the furnaces. Hydrogen is stored outside in a bunker with a blast ceiling so that the force of an explosion would go up.

5) Accident History.

There have been no accidents over the past 5 years.

6) Emergency Response Plan.

This facility submits an annual Hazardous material Business plan to the San Jose (CA) City Fire department showing type and locations of all solutions, facility lay-out and type and location of safety equipment.

Elcon/macroMetalics personnel have been to Industrial Waste (Wastewater), Hazardous Waste (Title 22), D.O.T. (49 CFR 172.704), HAZWOPPER (8CCR5192), and Emergency Response Technician training done by Outside Agencies.
